        public static int color(int r,
                        int g,
                        int b)
        Returns an integer describing the color when input the color's red, green and blue elements.
        Parameters:
        r - how much red? Values ranging from 0 to 255
        g - how much green? Values ranging from 0 to 255
        b - how much blue? Values ranging from 0 to 255
        Returns:
        the integer describing the color

      • mix3

        public static int mix3(int c1,
                       int c,
                       int c2,
                       float alpha)
        Mixes 3 colors together with the portions set by a parameter.

        If the parameter is in the range [-1, 0], it will mix the first and second colors.
        If the parameter is in the range [0, 1], it will mix the second and third colors.
        Parameters:
        c1 - the first color
        c - the second color
        c2 - the third color
        alpha - the parameter
        Returns:
        the color
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever alpha does not lie in the [-1, 1] range

      • mix3

        public static int mix3(int c1,
                       int c,
                       int c2,
                       double alpha)
        Mixes 3 colors together with the portions set by a parameter.

        If the parameter is in the range [-1, 0], it will mix the first and second colors.
        If the parameter is in the range [0, 1], it will mix the second and third colors.
        Parameters:
        c1 - the first color
        c - the second color
        c2 - the third color
        alpha - the parameter
        Returns:
        the color
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever alpha does not lie in the [-1, 1] range

      • mix2

        public static int mix2(int c1,
                       int c2,
                       float alpha)
                throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Mixes 2 colors together with a portion set by a parameter.

        This method splits the two colors into it's red, green and blue components. Then for each base color, the new base color will be calculated as r = r1 * alpha + r2 * (1 - alpha).
        Parameters:
        c1 - the first color
        c2 - the second color
        alpha - the portion of the first color
        Returns:
        the new color
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever alpha does not lie in the [0, 1] range

      • mix2

        public static int mix2(int c1,
                       int c2,
                       double alpha)
                throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Mixes 2 colors together with a portion set by a parameter.

        This method splits the two colors into it's red, green and blue components. Then for each base color, the new base color will be calculated as r = r1 * alpha + r2 * (1 - alpha).
        Parameters:
        c1 - the first color
        c2 - the second color
        alpha - the portion of the first color
        Returns:
        the new color
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever alpha does not lie in the [0, 1] range

      • imageToMatrix

        public static Matrix imageToMatrix(processing.core.PImage image,
                                   float lowerBound,
                                   float upperBound,
                                   float bias)
        Converts an image to a matrix.

        This method first grey-scale the image by using the makeGrey(int) method to each pixel.
        Each pixel now contains integer values from 0 to 255. The method will map the current values between 0 and 255 to values from lowerBound to upperBound.
        Finally, the method will add a bias if the bias parameter is set to a value different from 0 and returns the matrix.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be converted
        lowerBound - the lower bound of the pixels
        upperBound - the upper bound of the pixels
        bias - the additional bias for the matrix
        Returns:
        the matrix-converted image

      • imageToMatrix

        public static Matrix imageToMatrix(processing.core.PImage image,
                                   double lowerBound,
                                   double upperBound,
                                   double bias)
        Converts an image to a matrix.

        This method first grey-scale the image by using the makeGrey(int) method to each pixel.
        Each pixel now contains integer values from 0 to 255. The method will map the current values between 0 and 255 to values from lowerBound to upperBound.
        Finally, the method will add a bias if the bias parameter is set to a value different from 0 and returns the matrix.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be converted
        lowerBound - the lower bound of the pixels
        upperBound - the upper bound of the pixels
        bias - the additional bias for the matrix
        Returns:
        the matrix-converted image

      • imageToMatrix

        public static Matrix imageToMatrix(processing.core.PImage image,
                                   double lowerBound,
                                   double upperBound)
        Converts an image to a matrix.

        This method first grey-scale the image by using the makeGrey(int) method to each pixel.
        Each pixel now contains integer values from 0 to 255. The method will map the current values between 0 and 255 to values from lowerBound to upperBound.
        The method will not add a bias.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be converted
        lowerBound - the lower bound of the pixels
        upperBound - the upper bound of the pixels
        Returns:
        the matrix-converted image

      • imageToMatrix

        public static Matrix imageToMatrix(processing.core.PImage image,
                                   double bias)
        Converts an image to a matrix.

        This method first grey-scale the image by using the makeGrey(int) method to each pixel.
        Each pixel now contains integer values from 0 to 255. The method will map the current values between 0 and 255 to values from 0 to 1.
        Finally, the method will add a bias if the bias parameter is set to a value different from 0 and returns the matrix.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be converted
        bias - the additional bias for the matrix
        Returns:
        the matrix-converted image

      • imageToMatrix

        public static Matrix imageToMatrix(processing.core.PImage image)
        Converts an image to a matrix.

        This method first grey-scale the image by using the makeGrey(int) method to each pixel.
        Each pixel now contains integer values from 0 to 255. The method will map the current values between 0 and 255 to values from 0 to 1.
        The method will not add a bias.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to be converted
        Returns:
        the matrix-converted image

      • sign

        public static int sign(float value)
        Returns the sign of a value.

        There are 3 possible outputs:
        -1 occurs when the number is less than or equal to -epsilon 0 occurs when the number's absolute value is less than epsilon 1 occurs when the number is greater than or equal to epsilon
        Parameters:
        value - the value under consideration
        Returns:
        the sign of that value based on the rules above

      • sign

        public static int sign(double value)
        Returns the sign of a value.

        See sign(float) for more information
        Parameters:
        value - the value under consideration
        Returns:
        the sign of that value

      • gaussian

        public static float gaussian(float x,
                             float mu,
                             float sig)
        Returns the Gaussian distribution value at a specific coordinate, mean and deviation.
        Parameters:
        x - the location we want to calculate it
        mu - the average value
        sig - the deviation
        Returns:
        the Gaussian distribution value

      • gaussianReverse

        public static float gaussianReverse(float y,
                                    float mu,
                                    float sig)
        Returns the inverse function of the Gaussian distribution at a specific coordinate, mean and deviation.
        Parameters:
        y - the output value (this function finds the input value from the output value)
        mu - the average value
        sig - the deviation
        Returns:
        the inverse of the Gaussian distribution value
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever the suppied y exceeds the domain of the function

      • kron

        public static int kron(boolean bit)
        Returns 1 if true, 0 if false.

        This is inspired by the knonecker delta.
        Parameters:
        bit - the boolean passed in
        Returns:
        1 if true, 0 if false

      • kron

        public static int kron(int a,
                       int b)
        Kronecker delta, returns 1 if two values are the same and 0 otherwise.
        Parameters:
        a - the first value
        b - the second value
        Returns:
        1 if two values are the same and 0 otherwise

      • kron

        public static int kron(float a,
                       float b)
        Kronecker delta, returns 1 if two values are closer than Env#epsilon.
        Parameters:
        a - the first value
        b - the second value
        Returns:
        1 if two values are closer than Env#epsilon

      • call

        public static void call(java.lang.Object obj,
                        java.lang.String function,
                        _Float progress)
        Calls a method using reflection with an attached progress.
        Parameters:
        obj - the object you are calling from
        function - the name of the function to call

        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - whenever Java's Reflection API doesn't behave

                        java.lang.String function,
                        InfoPacket data)

        Parameters:

        function - the name of the function to call
        data - the data to pass into the function
        Throws:
